main event: Four air crew members observed a bright white light proceeding from east to south at low speed near Waco, Texas on January 21, 1954.
interesting points: The sighting was reported as a CIRVIS incident., The light was approximately 10 miles east of the aircraft., The aircraft altitude was about 19,000 feet., Witnesses reported clear weather conditions at the time., Multiple conclusions suggested the object could be a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon.
